authorsByline: Adam Goldman, Glenn Thrush and Mattathias Schwartz
title: Russia Is Suspected to Be Behind Breach of Federal Court Filing System
description: Federal officials are scrambling to assess the damage and address flaws in a sprawling, heavily used computer system long known to have vulnerabilities.
content:
Investigators have uncovered evidence that Russia is at least in part responsible for a recent hack of the computer system that manages federal court documents, including highly sensitive records that might contain information that could reveal sources and people charged with national security crimes, according to several people briefed on the breach.

It is not clear what entity is responsible, whether an arm of Russian intelligence might be behind the intrusion or if other countries were also involved, which some of the people familiar with the matter described as a yearslong effort to infiltrate the system. Some of the searches included midlevel criminal cases in the New York City area and several other jurisdictions, with some cases involving people with Russian and Eastern European surnames.

The disclosure comes as President Trump is expected to meet with his Russian counterpart, Vladimir V. Putin, in Alaska on Friday, where Mr. Trump is planning to discuss his push to end the war in Ukraine.

Administrators with the court system recently informed Justice Department officials, clerks and chief judges in federal courts that “persistent and sophisticated cyber threat actors have recently compromised sealed records,” according to an internal department memo and reviewed by The New York Times. The administrators also advised those officials to quickly remove the most sensitive documents from the system.
summary: Investigators have found evidence that Russia is responsible for a recent hack of the computer system that manages federal court documents, including highly sensitive records that could potentially reveal sources and individuals involved in national security crimes. It is unclear whether an arm of Russian intelligence or if other countries were also involved in the incident. The breach was discovered during a thorough investigation into the system. Administrators with the court system have informed officials about the incident and have advised them to remove the most sensitive documents from the system immediately.
shortSummary: Russian hackers may have been behind a recent cyber attack on the Federal Court documents, potentially exposing sensitive information about sources and potential national security threats.
argos_summary: Investigators have found evidence linking Russia to a recent hack of the federal court document management system, which may have exposed sensitive information related to national security cases. The breach appears to be part of a long-term effort to infiltrate the system, with some searches targeting midlevel criminal cases involving individuals with Russian and Eastern European connections. This revelation comes as President Trump prepares for a meeting with Russian President Vladimir Putin, where discussions will include the conflict in Ukraine.
